intro: Rosa uriensis var. gracilis, commonly known as the slender sand玫瑰, is a compact shrub native to the northeastern United States. It features small, fragrant flowers in shades of pink and white, typically blooming in late spring to early summer. The plant has slender, arching stems with dark green, serrated leaves. It thrives in well-drained soil and partial to full sun, making it suitable for rock gardens or as a border plant. Its ornamental value is enhanced by its delicate appearance and long-lasting blooms.
